msContents.summary: Order for payment of sixty artabae of wheat to Sarapion, son of Heliodorus, addressed to the overseers of granaries, in the village of Petne in the middle toparchy, by Lampon, son of Ammonius. 179 C.E.

msItemStruct.note: Text on one side only, 14 lines against the fibers, clean margins. Text mentions the village of Petne.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Lampon, son of Ammonius, manager of the house of the gymnasiarchs of Oxyrynchos, to the collectors of the corn revenue of the middle toparchy at Petne, greeting. Pay from the past 19th year's store of wheat belonging to the gymnasiarchs and deposited with you, sixty artabae, 60 art., to Sarapion, son of Heliodorus, late exegetes at Oxyrynchos. The 20th year of Aurelius Antonius Caesar and Aurelius Commodius Caesar our sovereigns, Athyr 3. (Grenfell & Hunt)
